page.title: 01Rural area on edge of town.
page.content: The area covered by this block is mainly rural with much of the the land under cereal crop cultivation. On the Eastern edge is the Bretch Hill estate of Banbury which was built for London and Birmingham overspill housing. As the estate has stablised so the social problems of single parent families, unemployment, and crime, particularly vandalism, have grown. In the area is the small hamlet of Drayton and the picturesque village of Wroxton with its pond and Abbey. The Abbey is now part of an American University. From the dovecote in the Abbey grounds start two circular walks through this typical North Oxfordshire countryside. There is little employment in the area apart from the odd shop, farm, school or public house. People travel to Banbury for work, shopping and leisure activities.
